title: Migraine
scope: ** Evaluation and management of acute migraine, status migrainosus, and chronic migraine in adults. Covers abortive therapy, rescue treatment for refractory attacks, and preventive medication initiation. Includes special considerations for pregnancy and medication overuse. Excludes secondary headache disorders, cluster headache, and tension-type headache.

Essential/Core Labs.rationale: Low levels may contribute to migraines

Extended Workup (Second-line).rationale: If GCA or inflammatory cause suspected (>50 years, new onset)
Elevated levels associated with migraine with aura

Rare/Specialized.rationale: Thunderclap headache, suspected SAH, IIH, meningitis
If vasculitis or autoimmune cause suspected

Essential/First-line.timing: If thunderclap, worst headache, focal deficits, altered mental status
New headache pattern, focal features, refractory to treatment

Extended.item: MRI brain with and without contrast (CPT 70553)
Extended.timing: If mass, infection, or inflammation suspected
Prior to DHE or triptan use

dosing.instructions: 1000 mg PO once, max 3000 mg/day
400-800 mg PO once

Acute/Abortive Treatment - Mild-Moderate.contraindications: Renal disease, GI bleeding, aspirin allergy

dosing.instructions: 500-825 mg PO once
900-1000 mg PO once
2 tablets PO once
6 mg SC once; may repeat in 2h; max 12 mg/24h

Acute/Abortive Treatment - Moderate-Seve.contraindications: CAD, stroke/TIA, uncontrolled HTN, hemiplegic/basilar migraine, pregnancy

dosing.instructions: 50-100 mg PO once; may repeat in 2h; max 200 mg/24h
20 mg intranasal; may repeat in 2h; max 40 mg/24h
5-10 mg PO (ODT available); may repeat in 2h; max 30 mg/24h
40 mg PO; may repeat in 2h; max 80 mg/24h
2.5-5 mg PO or nasal; may repeat in 2h; max 10 mg/24h
50-100 mg PO; may repeat in 2h; max 200 mg/24h

doseOptions.orderSentence: Rimegepant 75 mg PO every other day

dosing.instructions: 75 mg PO once daily; ODT formulation
10 mg intranasal once daily
NS or LR 1L bolus, then 75-125 mL/hr
10 mg IV slow push over 5-10 min; may repeat in 30 min
10-20 mg IV over 15-30 min; may repeat in 30 min
25-50 mg IV to prevent akathisia (give with antiemetic)
30 mg IV (15 mg if >65y or CrCl <50); max 2 doses

doseOptions.orderSentence: Dexamethasone 10 mg IV once then 4 mg q6h

dosing.instructions: 10 mg IV once (reduces recurrence)

doseOptions.orderSentence: Magnesium Sulfate 4 g IV loading dose

dosing.instructions: 2 g IV over 20-30 min
500-1000 mg IV over 15-30 min
Premedicate: metoclopramide 10 mg IV + diphenhydramine 25 mg IV; Test dose: 0.5 mg IV over 1 min; If tolerated: 0.5-1 mg IV q8h

ED/Inpatient - Refractory/Second-Line Th.contraindications: Pregnancy, CAD, CVA, uncontrolled HTN, triptan <24h, ergot allergy

dosing.instructions: 0.5 mg per nostril (1 mg total); may repeat once in 15 min; max 3 mg/24h
1000 mg PO/IV q8h; max 3000 mg/day
10 mg IV/PO q8h
4-8 mg IV/PO q8h

doseOptions.orderSentence: Magnesium Sulfate 4 g IV loading dose

dosing.instructions: 2 g IV once
Lidocaine 1% or bupivacaine 0.25%, 2-3 mL per side
6 mg SC x1 (pregnancy registry data reassuring)
Start 40-80 mg/day in divided doses; target 80-240 mg/day
Start 25-50 mg BID; target 100-200 mg/day
Start 25 mg QHS; increase by 25 mg/week to 50-100 mg BID
Start 10-25 mg QHS; target 50-150 mg QHS
Start 37.5 mg daily; target 75-150 mg daily
70-140 mg SC monthly
225 mg SC monthly OR 675 mg SC quarterly
240 mg SC loading, then 120 mg SC monthly
100-300 mg IV q3 months
Start 250-500 mg BID; target 500-1500 mg/day
155-195 units IM q12 weeks (chronic migraine only)
10-60 mg PO daily
75 mg every other day
400-600 mg PO daily
400 mg PO daily
100 mg TID

Referrals & Consults.indication: Status migrainosus, refractory to ED treatment
Chronic migraine, medication overuse, refractory disease
Refractory chronic migraine, nerve block consideration

Patient/Family Instructions.item: Keep headache diary (frequency, severity, triggers, medications)
Treat migraine early - medications more effective within first hour
Avoid medication overuse: limit triptans to 9 days/month, NSAIDs to 14 days/month
Follow up with neurologist in 2-4 weeks if new diagnosis
Follow up with PCP or neurologist for preventive medication monitoring
Return to ED if: worst headache of life, fever, neurologic deficits, altered mental status

Lifestyle & Prevention.item: Avoid known triggers: alcohol, aged cheese, MSG, processed meats, irregular meals
Limit caffeine to consistent moderate intake (<200 mg/day)
Consider migraine glasses (FL-41 tint) for photophobia

differential.features: Unilateral periorbital, autonomic features (tearing, rhinorrhea), short duration (15-180 min), circadian pattern
Chronic daily headache, >15 days/month, frequent analgesic use
Thunderclap onset, "worst headache of life," neck stiffness
differential.tests: CT head, LP if CT negative

differential.features: Papilledema, visual obscurations, pulsatile tinnitus, bilateral pressure
differential.tests: LP with elevated OP (>25 cm H2O)

differential.features: Age >50, new headache, jaw claudication, scalp tenderness, visual symptoms
Progressive headache, seizures, focal deficits, pregnancy/OCP
Neck pain, limited ROM, triggered by neck movement
Short attacks, autonomic features, response to indomethacin (some types)
Progressive headache, worse in morning/with Valsalva, focal deficits

evidence.source: [Friedman et al. Ann Emerg Med 2008](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/18006188/); [AHS Evidence Assessment 2016](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/27300483/)
[PREEMPT pooled analysis, Dodick et al. 2010](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/20487038/); [Aurora et al. Cephalalgia 2010](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/20647170/)

evidence.recommendation: Gepants effective for acute and preventive treatment

disposition.criteria: Pain controlled, able to tolerate PO, no red flags, close follow-up arranged
Status migrainosus unresponsive to ED treatment, need for DHE protocol, unable to tolerate PO, severe dehydration, concern for secondary headache
Rare - suspected intracranial pathology, hemodynamic instability
Pain controlled on oral medications, tolerating PO, ambulatory
New diagnosis: 2-4 weeks; Chronic migraine: q1-3 months; On preventive: q3-6 months after stable
